## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:** [AT1G02910](https://www.arabidopsis.org/locus?name=AT1G02910)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>LPA1</u>
- **Gene Name:** LOW PSII ACCUMULATION1
- **Description:**   tetratricopeptide repeat (TPR)-containing protein;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** 
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [SALK_124398]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Increased sensitivity to oryzalin, roots significantly shortened.
   - [lpa1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;The leaves of the mutant are paler than those of the wild type, and growth is significantly reduced. The leaf area of the mutant is ~75% lower than that of wild-type plants 26 d after germination.
   - [lpa1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;The mutants have defects in energy transfer within PSII or a partial loss of PSII capacity.
   - [lpa1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;The relative amounts of the PSII core subunits CP47, CP43, D1, and D2 is greatly reduced in the mutant, especially the PSII dimer.
   - [lpa1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Wild-type chloroplasts are larger than those of the mutant and have a larger number of discs per grana stack on average. In addition, the wild-type chloroplasts display well-developed membrane systems composed of grana connected by the stroma lamellae, but the thylakoid membrane systems in mutant chloroplasts are disturbed, and the membrane spacing is not as clear.
